column12:
I had a quick 2 Nights stay at Heritance Ahungalla in October during my recent trip to Srilanka. This resort is in quiant  town of Ahungalla which is roughly 2 hrs drive from Colombo Airport. Though the entrance to the resort is  bang on main road, the rooms and overall facilities of the resort are tucked away in quite zone away from the main road. 

The resort has choice of rooms with Garden View, Pool View and Sea View. All the rooms have a sit out or balcony.  All other facilities needed for relaxing holiday like Restaurants, Gym, Games Centre, Swimming Pool, SPA is available at the resort. 

The rooms at the resort are of decent size with comfortable and functional bathroom. The upkeep of the rooms and overall resort, facilities are top notch. The staff at resort are welcoming and helpful to your requests. 

The resorts direct access to the beach is added bonus with the beach being quiet scheduled and more or less being private to In House Guests.

For Dining options the resort has their Main Restaurant which  offers Buffet & Al Carte options apart from  Pool Bar and Speciality Restaurants too. The Breakfast buffet is sumptuous with vide variety of food ranging from Local Srilankan  to international cusine. The Vegetarians options for breakfast  don't disappoint either with plenty of options from Local Srilankan, Indian & Continental Cuisine to choose from. The taste and quality of food served at breakfast is equally of high standard .

For Lunch or Dinner you can choose to go with Buffet or Al Carte. The prices for dishes in Al Carte is quite reasonable with decent choice for Vegetarians too. 

I had my dinner at their all day dining restaurant and surprisingly the Indian Chef dished out simple yet delicious Indian Fare. 

I would like to extend my appreciation for the Chef Mr.Balbeer Singh who was quite accommodative and helpful in suggesting the food choice considering we were vegetarian.  If you are craving for Indian Food at this resort then don't hesitate to reach out to Chef Balbeer Singh who will at your service with great suggestions. Thanks Chef for all your help and support during our stay at Heritance Ahungalla. Keep doing the good work.

From Excursion  or Sightseeing Point Heritance Ahungalla is reasonably placed from key sightseeing places like Galle, Bentota, Hikkaduwa etc; Most of these places are under 30-60 minutes drive from resort.

I throughly enjoyed my stay at Heritance Ahungalla and will definitely look forward to staying at Heritance Ahungalla the next time  I am in Srilanka. 

A big shout out and sincere appreciation to all the people behind the scenes at the resort who are going the extra mile to keep the guests comfortable and happy.

I recently stayed at Heritance Ahungalla and it was a impressive and comfortable stay! The staff were friendly and welcoming. 
The hotel is designed by Deshamanya Jeoffery Bawa and is wonderful in all sense. The vastness and aesthetics of the property, the breathtaking views of the pool, beach and the surroundings from the moment you enter the hotel. It is definitely an experience. The salt in the air singes your nose in the best way possible. They have tried to upkeep the original architecture of the building from the 1980's as much as possible and it is pleasant on the eyes. 

The breakfast buffet was decent and had south Indian options. The breakfast buffet had alot of options and varieties, however, the taste of the food did slightly fall behind for the price paid and for what was expected. This also applies to their Dinner buffet. On the other hand, the room service menu though very limited has tasty and reasonably priced options (special mention to the nasi goreng, which was delicious with a good portion size).

A special note on the very wonderful welcome we recieved at the property. The cold towel and the welcome drink was refreshing and the staff are very very polite and willing to help you with anything. 

Me and my wife, we stayed in the 'luxury room' category of rooms. The room was pleasant and spacious with 'L' shaped balcony access. The views from the balcony did not bore us throughout our stay, breathtaking every single time. We just stayed at the property and enjoyed the property itself. However, travelling to nearby locations such an Lunuganga, Bentota river sports, etc should not be an issue at all, as the property is very accessible by uber/pickme. 

However, despite the food being okay, it's better to opt for full board or atleast half board as there are not many options for restaurants nearby.

I highly recommend the hotel to anyone seeking to have a relaxing vacation on the beach while enjoying a piece of Bawa architecture.

Rating Breakdown:

- Cleanliness: 5/5
- Service: 4/5
- Value: 4.5/5
- Location: 5/5
- Sleep Quality: 5/5

column10: Planning to stay here over a long weekend? Consider rethinking or lowering expectations, as service quality may drop during peak times
column12:
Hotel RIU used to be one of my favorite hotels. I had visited twice before and had great experiences each time. Given those positive stays, I decided to return for a third visit on the long weekend of September 14th. Unfortunately, this time was very different, and I was disappointed by the poor experience we had. The staff’s treatment of guests was also subpar, which I assume might have been due to the holiday crowd. However, as a 5-star hotel, they should be equipped to handle a full house, and if they cannot, they should limit their bookings. Here are some of the issues we faced that may be helpful for anyone considering a stay at this hotel:

Room Cleanliness - The floor was sticky, and we couldn’t walk comfortably without slippers.

Room Configuration - We were a 3 families of six and had reserved three full-board rooms, requesting double beds for each. Despite this clear request in our online booking, we were given rooms with twin beds. When I asked for them to be changed, the hotel declined, only agreeing to push two twin beds together only in two of the three rooms. As a result, one family ended up having to sleep on two separate beds.

Bed Quality - The beds were uncomfortable and wobbly, moving apart even when simply sitting on them. This was especially frustrating in the rooms where twin beds were pushed together.

Food Hygiene - There were flies in the food cabinet with the evening snacks, particularly on the burgers. I mentioned this to a chef, but my concern was dismissed.

Bathroom Issues - One room’s main shower was broken, leaving only the handheld shower functional. Despite reporting this to room service three times, no one came to fix it.

While I understand that the long weekend likely increased their workload, a hotel of this standard should be able to maintain quality service even during busy periods. If they cannot handle the crowd, they should consider limiting bookings. For anyone planning to stay here during a holiday, I would suggest reconsidering or making sure that expectations are adjusted for a potentially lower quality of service.
column13: Think Twice Before Booking Hotel RIU on a Holiday Weekend

column12:
This is one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. It was spotless. Staff were constantly cleaning.
All the staff were great and a credit to the hotel. I would like to particularly thank:
Malinda, in the restaurant.
The bar staff in the purple lounge, 
Dumind and Samera who looked after our room to a very high standard.  We loved the towel art, so clever and imaginative.

The buffet food was tasty enough and regularly replenished, however after a week the food choice was rather monotonous and at times bland. 
The speciality restaurants were better even though the menus never changed. Pity as the food was really good especially as it was all freshly cooked.

I loved the way staff ensured that the adult pool remained so. Quickly asking parents to return to one of the other pools with their children.

The beach was stunning, unfortunately due to the time of year the sea was too rough to swim in. 
Walking along the beach, Ahungalla turtle conservation and hatchery was within easy walking distance, we couldn’t visit as unfortunately we hadn’t taken any money with us.

Downside
To access the beach you had to run the gauntlet past the local stalls. The women were pushy, bordering on annoying, even if you managed to avoid them getting to and from the beach they would loiter around the fence calling you to look at their wears, some took no for an answer others didn’t. Please bare in mind they are very expensive compared to others at the front of the hotel.
One or 2 were constantly hassling you for the contents of your mini bar and complimentary toiletries, when I refused, she replied but they are free for you!

The worst thing about the hotel were some of the male guests, who persistently videoed women in the aqua class, it made me feel uncomfortable, who knows where the videos might end up, others would video women by the pool and even the children! (I highlighted this issue but it wasn’t addressed whilst I was a guest.) Hopefully something has now been done.

Getting about
The beach tuk tuk drivers were also eagerly waiting to introduce themselves to new guests (they have a living to make!) A polite ‘not interested’ was enough for them not to bother you again.
There are also tuk tuk drivers by the hotel entrance, we used Obamah,whats app +94774618755. We even booked some of our trips from home especially the longer ones. I’m sure the other drivers are equally as good.

All in all you will not be disappointed.

column10: Pre-book any restaurants you want during your stay at check-in.
column12:

We are currently here, checked in yesterday and restaurants are pretty much booked up for the week unless you fancy the Italian. Tried to book the Saute restaurant but booked out for the week. Rooms are a decent size with a good shower. Fully tiled floors, which means anyone above you that doesn't lift the chairs and drag them you will know about it.

Nice accommodating staff.
A couple of bars drinks are ok.

column12:
My rating of this hotel is based on the fact it is billed as a 5 star hotel however it is clear that not all 5 star places live up to their billing. 

Food - very poor mostly canteen style with no live cooking stations as advertised. Food at best was warm and not of the best quality. If you like pizza and chips you might be ok but make sure you get it when it is first out or they could be cold too! You would also not expect to eat off plastic plates at a 5 star restaurant - well in this one you do!! The glasses for the drinks and cutlery were also very tired and not the cleanest. 

Drinks - I only drink Decaffeinated tea and coffee so you would think a 5 star hotel would be able to accommodate that request- not this one half the people you asked didn’t even know what I was talking about and the others who did just said sorry no we don’t have any. The all inclusive drinks were of very low quality no international branded alcohol. If you wanted bottled water by the pool don’t expect to get a nice chilled bottle just a warm one from a shelf ( just what you want a hot day !!!!)

Pools - there were 3 nice pools but not a single life guard at any of them - obviously healthy and safely is not a priority! 

Room. - spacious and clean but don’t expect any 5* luxuries.

Hospitality / Staff - vey friendly and attentive.

All in all a poor hotel that we will not be returning to any time soon.

column290:
We arrived early on a Sunday morning, and from the moment we arrived, we knew we were going to feel at home 
The hotel itself is well maintained, spacious, and so clean. It is set just a few steps from the Indian Ocean and beach, which you can access from the hotel.
The gardens are beautiful, and you can see so much work goes into them to maintain them to such a high standard!
There are 4 pool, one for children, another for activities such as volley ball, the others two are general pools, but one is sectioned into two parts, with one part for adults only with a swim up bar 😁 Again we'll maintained and so clean.
The rooms are spacious with plenty of storage, and as I always do, I inspected for cleanliness and couldn't find fault. The housekeeping team cleaned the rooms daily, with clean linen and towels daily. A lovely touch is the towel animals and flowers on the beds daily
The food is excellent, a wide variety and don't worry if you don't like spicy food as there is so much to choose from. Personally, we love the spice and make the most of it. There are also three restaurants where you can book tables in Asian, Italian and grill, truly delicious food
There is entertainment every day, and you can tell the team put a lot of work into it all to ensure you are fully entertained, with drinks flowing if you wish 
I could go on praising Hotel Riu, but what makes it is the staff )to many to name). They are such hard-working, kind, attentive people who, no matter how busy they are, always have time for you, with a smile on their faces. In fact we feel we have made friends for life and cannot thank them enough.
